title: Kuva Space Raises €16.6M for Subscription-Based Hyperspectral Imaging Service
summary:
Finnish Earth observation startup Kuva Space has closed an oversubscribed funding round that raised €16.6 million. The company announced on 2 November that it had raised the growth funding. The round was led by existing investors Voima Ventures and Nordic Foodtech VC, with participation from EARTH VC, private investors through Springvest, and Business Finland. “Our […]
The post Kuva Space Raises €16.6M for Subscription-Based Hyperspectral Imaging Service appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: House bill would fully fund Mars Sample Return, block cooperation on ExoMars
summary: House appropriators would fully fund NASA’s Mars Sample Return program despite its ongoing problems but halt the agency’s plans to cooperate with a European Mars mission.

title: Astra defaults on debt agreement, warns it may not be able to raise needed cash
summary: Struggling space company Astra disclosed in a securities filing late Friday that it defaulted on a recent debt agreement and may not be able to raise needed cash as funds dwindle.

title: It’s almost showtime for SpaceX’s massive Starship rocket
summary: SpaceX will again target a morning liftoff for the rocket.

title: How long will Jeff Bezos continue to subsidize his New Shepard rocket?
summary: "It's definitely a money loser. Always has been."

title: Revealing the Startup of the Year finalists for the SpaceNews 2023 Icon Awards
summary: SpaceNews is pleased to spotlight the finalists for the Startup of the Year award, companies that have managed to capture our attention for their contributions to the space industry.

title: Norway Officially Opens “First Operational Spaceport in Continental Europe”
summary:
Norway has officially opened what it calls the “first operational spaceport in continental Europe.” Andoya Spaceport was inaugurated on 2 November by Norway’s Crown Prince Haakon. The new spaceport is located in Nordmela on the Norwegian Island of Andoya. Although the spaceport will eventually include several launch pads, just one has been completed to date. […]
The post Norway Officially Opens “First Operational Spaceport in Continental Europe” appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Norway opens Andøya spaceport
summary: Norway inaugurated its northern Andøya spaceport Thursday as commercial launch competition on continental Europe heats up.

title: NASA open to extending ISS beyond 2030
summary: A NASA official opened the door to keeping the International Space Station in operation beyond 2030 if commercial space stations are not yet ready to take over by the end of the decade.

title: Daily Telescope: Lucy finds not one but two diamonds in the sky
summary: "The fact that it is two makes it even more exciting."
